meanings.definition: Showing shrewdness and good judgment, especially in money or business matters.
meanings.sent1: She made a canny investment that doubled her money.
meanings.sent2: The canny businessman always knew the best time to buy stocks.
meanings.sent3: His canny decision to buy the discounted items saved him a lot of money.
meanings.sent4: Her canny negotiation skills were like a sharp blade in the business world.
meanings.sent5: The canny fox outsmarted the other animals in the forest.

meanings.sent1: The canny joke made everyone laugh heartily.
meanings.sent2: Her canny sense of humor brightened up the room.
meanings.sent3: The canny prank played by the kids was harmless and funny.
meanings.sent4: His canny wit was like a ray of sunshine on a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The canny clown entertained the children with his silly antics.

meanings.definition: Careful and cautious in one's actions.
meanings.sent1: She took a canny approach to crossing the busy street.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was canny as he navigated the treacherous mountain path.
meanings.sent3: His canny steps on the icy sidewalk prevented him from slipping.
meanings.sent4: The canny driver avoided the accident by braking just in time.
meanings.sent5: Being canny while handling fragile items is crucial to avoid breakage.
